title: Boris’s great advantage? People are fed up with Brexit
text:
News of Boris Johnson’s Brexit deal got a good reception here in Washington, where I have been mingling with finance ministers and central bankers for the annual meetings of the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank.

Not only does it potentially remove a key issue of uncertainty in the global economy, but it should also open the door to striking a comprehensive free trade deal with the US.

The pound jumped, stock markets jumped, why even Kristalina Georgieva, the IMF’s new managing director, says she jumped.

Assuming it eventually passes Parliament, despite Oliver Letwin, at some stage in the next two weeks, Boris will have succeeded where Theresa May failed. A diplomatic triumph, then. ...
description: News of Boris Johnson’s Brexit deal got a good reception here in Washington, where I have been mingling with finance ministers and central bankers for the annual meetings of the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank.
